We Represent Injury Victims Of Inadequate Security Measures

Owners of stores, shopping centers, hotels, apartment complexes and other establishments have a duty to protect guests and customers from dangerous situations.

A failure to implement adequate security measures can lead to injury.

Such failures can include:

  • Nonfunctioning security systems
  • Broken door or window locks
  • Poor lighting that can give criminals areas to hide
  • Poorly trained or missing security guards
  • Missing or nonfunctioning video cameras at building entrances

If you or a loved one suffered injury because of any of the above, the property owner could be held accountable.

Holding Negligent Business Owners Accountable

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our law firm has a 50-year tradition of representing injured people and the families of wrongful death victims in Columbus and throughout Ohio. If you or a loved one was injured because of inadequate security, our attorneys can help.

We want to hear what happened. If our lawyers believe the property owner was negligent, we will spend the time and resources it takes to obtain the compensation you deserve.

Contact Our Lawyers Today

Call 614-360-2706 to schedule an appointment to talk to a lawyer today. No matter how you were injured, we will provide you a free initial consultation to discuss your case.

You can also send us a confidential email.
